sources.title: The Last Warning (1928)
sources.description: "The Last Warning" (1928) is a horror film directed by Paul Leni . The film is notable for being an early example of the horror genre during the silent era.The story revolves around a mysterious murder that occurs during a theater production. As the plot unfolds, the cast becomes entwined in a chilling atmosphere filled with suspense and supernatural elements.The film is often remembered for its unique blend of stage and screen horror, and it contributes to the early development of horror cinema. Although it may not be widely available today, it holds a place in cinematic history for its stylistic approaches and thematic elements.

metadata.Plot: A producer decides to reopen a theater, that had been closed five years previously when one of the actors was murdered during a performance, by staging a production of the same play with the remaining members of the original cast.
metadata.Writer: Wadsworth Camp, Alfred A. Cohn, Thomas F. Fallon
metadata.Actors: Laura La Plante, Montagu Love, Roy D'Arcy
